title: ADC complains about doing no damage to a tank while enemy ADC shreds our tanks
body:
No {{item:3035}} or {{item:3036}} in our ADC's inventory, enemy ADC has {{item:3153}} {{item:3036}} and triple our ADC's damage to champions

https://coubsecure-a.akamaihd.net/get/bucket:32.11/p/coub/simple/cw_timeline_pic/e799c484f30/8eb1a2274519004775b1d/big_1407796282_image.jpg

replies.body: {{champion:67}} {{item:3153}} *~~evil~~ laugh of purging*
Or {{champion:90}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3116}}.
If you're gonna build around e, where's the {{item:3078}}? >:(
Vayne does 840 true damage every third hit vs that guy and his build. Yeah Cool shit aye ?

Reminds me when I started a game in aram as an adc and 4 enemies were tanks... I said "Fuck this" and started the game with last whisper. Strangely enough, it did more damage than I'd expect with a BF.

People for some reason forget that % armor pen exists for tanks. In the past LW was a standard 3rd item for ADC's because it would cut through everything. These days, people forget that even though it's not so good vs other squishies it's a fairly cheap investment to cut through tanks and still provide an okish 25 AD as a 2nd or 3rd item before resuming the standard crit builds

In my road to return to Plat from Gold I see ADC's build that item once every 7-8 games...even against multiple tanks

Actually LDR is the one that is more effective against tanks and its more expensive than old LW. It also requires you dedicate an entire item slot just to killing tanks, since its useless against squishy champs. Its also very hard to work into a build, You still need real AD and Crit chance as well as sustain before you want to go melting a tank, at best its like a 4th item right now. 

Also not quite sure why you included Blade of the Ruined King in your op, pretty much a lot of people agree that the nerf made worse over all even for its intended purpose against tanky targets.

{{item:3036}}  is not useless vs squishy champs even if it's not the best item. ADC's in general have the lowest HP pools in the game meaning that they're almost guaranteed to do bonus damage to anyone, even the assassins who are attempting to dive them. 40 AD also isn't useless vs squishies either

Plus, {{item:3035}} alone is already effective enough against tanks in the mid game and can be upgraded later, much like how some champs like to buy {{item:3751}} for waveclear and not upgrade until later. For the same price as a{{item:1038}} you get 15 less AD but significantly more power against tanks who are usually the first targets to get shot by ADC's in teamfights

This is called build flexibility. Tanks, bruisers, and even mages and assassins have to adjust their builds to tailor to the state of the game, why shouldn't ADC's?

And why did I include {{item:3153}} ? Well who cares if it's less effective than before when it's still one of the BEST anti-tank items in the game, and it's still cheaper than the typical {{item:3072}} and massively increases an ADC's damage to a tank. In the game I am specifically referring to in my OP, the enemy {{champion:81}} (a champ who traditionally struggles against tanks) did significantly more damage than our team's {{champion:18}} a champion who isn't particularly outstanding against tanks, but is definitely better suited to deal with tanks than Ezreal

sometimes i build a {{item:3071}} as jinx (only when i cant trust my allies to have some armor pent) i mean yeah most adcs wont get BC but i feel its a pretty good item on them as it gives health a passive to keep up with someone so its harder for them to run away and easy for you to keep up. i just like the item on an adc but i only gett it vs like if they have maybe 1 or 2 tanks enemy team full tank then {{item:3035}} ,{{item:3036}} , or {{item:3033}}. plus the health is nice to help you surive say like an assassion full combo sometimes i also get a {{item:3022}}
I don't understand you last comment. Didn't you just make the point that they should be building it against tanks, especially when there are that many?
...yes? I'm simply commenting that I'm confused why ADC's in my elo flat out refuse to buy such a strong anti-tank item against multiple tanks
Oh I'm seeing where I read it wrong. Sorry ._.

Armor pen has a multiplicative effect on damage.  When you have 10 flat armor pen, your enemies have 10% less health against you, meaning you are essentially doing 10% more damage.  Most people don't understand this

that isn't how it works. If they have 100 armor and you have 10 armor pen, then that's 10% less health. If they have 200 armor and you have 10 armor pen, that's 5% less health. Flat armor pen only goes the amount of armor that it says. if you have 10% armor pen though, then they have 20% less health no matter what.
Effective health means that for every point of armor, you have 1% more health vs physical damage, no matter how much armor you have. The opposite is also true, 1 less armor equals -1 percent health.

So if I have 100 flat arpen... then every one on the opposing team has 100% less health... which means they have...

\*GASP\* ZERO HEALTH... THE OPNESS- wait no, adc's only have, like, 73 armor, so they still have 27% of their health, oh well... FREAKIN' RITO, NERF ADC'S ALREADY

My point being: You really need to keep in mind what your percent's are referring to, otherwise, you're post a) could mean anything, b) teaches nothing, and c) is flat out misleading.

... Get it? FLAT out? 'cause... 'cause it's flat arpen? ... it's a pun...

\*crickets\*

... ... I'll see myself out now.

P.S. 1 arpen = 1% of enemy's ACTUAL health subtracted from their EFFECTIVE health.

Example: 

* {{champion:44}} with 3k health and 300 (just 300? YOU'RE SLIPPING TARIC!!!).
* That gives him 300% of his actual health in additional health.
* Ergo, he has 12,000 effective health.
* 1 flat arpen = 1% of 3k ACTUAL health = 300 health
* You've just reduced 12,000 effective health by 300.

You can see why this isn't very impressive. Percent arpen is always needed FIRST if the enemy's 150+ in armor. Flat is only useful once you've shredded or % penetrated someone down to, say, 100 armor (or they're like that to begin with) Then every 1 flat arpen is handy.

To reinforce how important this is: If you're against a squishy with 50 armor, and you have 50 arpen, you will be doing 50% extra POST-MITIGATION damage (i.e. reducing their ACTUAL health, the only thing we really care about, by 50% more) than if you had 0 arpen. It gets to be almost like a crit at a certain point. IF, however, it's someone who has 400 armor, and you have 50 flat arpen (no percent), you'll do only 11% extra POST-MITIGATION damage. You really need that fighter's cleaver-assist and your personal lw for these scenarios. THEN think about flat.

It gets to be almost like a crit at a certain point. IF, however, it's someone who has 400 armor, and you have 50 flat arpen (no percent), you'll do only 11% extra POST-MITIGATION damage. You really need that fighter's cleaver-assist and your personal lw for these scenarios. THEN think about flat.

A little too excited there buddy. 
1 armor is 1% more of your health pool as effective health vs physical damage. Thus if you have 4000 health and 200 armor you have 12,000 effective health vs physical damage. Lord dominiks, assuming you have base 50 armor and have 2000 more hp than the enemy makes it so that the enemy see you have around 130 armor, so you'd be down from 12,000 effective health to around 9,333 (note I'm not bothering to pull out a calculator for this). And 15% more damage furthermore means that you can divide that by 1.15 which means you drop to around 8,000 hp, meaning lord dominiks in this case effectively drops you to 2/3rds of your effective hp. Just the % pen drops you by 3/4 or so.  Theoretically, if you had such a huge amount of armor that your base armor was insignificant in comparison, then it would approach dropping you by 45%.

As for flat pen, it's much better vs squishies, true. Because as armor approaches a huge number flat pen becomes insignificant. However as one's armor approaches the amount of flat pen the enemy has, then flat pen becomes much more significant.

It takes too many items, runes, and masteries to itemize flat pen, hence adcs tend to avoid it as it's not easy to obtain.

It's the evening coffee.

Aaaaand everything you just said agrees with what I said... so there.

It's the caffeine I had as well. I was excited to throw some math around and I threw it at you cause you appeared to be the most excited of the bunch.

Also the whole TL;DR thing applies too sadly. I read the first half and got bored and went right to the math.

I don't understand either,

But it makes sense. Oh it makes sense somehow it does.
I guess... Mostly I keep getting told that I should build that 3rd-4th item and such, so I never expected last whisper to make much of a difference.

It's a more pronounced effect on castor style ADCs like sivir and varus because the multiplicative effect applies to base damage as well.
But yeah your build order should be reactive. Generally you build ie+ another crit item first because of the relationship between them, but it shouldn't always be the case.  Getting last whisper second vs a taric or malphite is a really good idea, or if the toplane tank is an issue.

Started a game of aram, got ashe. The enemy jarvan didn't start tank, so I got LW as 3rd item when he started to actually get armor...

Shame they managed to destroy my team's stuff in 20 seconds instead of the logical 2 minutes. :-/
Why were you playing a game in Iran?
Its only possible when you are vayne, kog, twitch, or ezreal. Ie and crit is more expensive than your chinese price defensive items
You realize that {{item:3035}} and {{item:3036}} are cheaper than {{item:3742}} right?

It depends on what champion you are too.  Sure Armor Pen matters, but some ADCs will shred tanks better than others regardless of that.

Vayne can eat tanks.  Given the items you listed their ADC as having, was it Vayne?  Most ADCs can't build BotRK first, but she can.  It would be trash on most of the others.

You also don't mention at what point in the game you are at.  Sure you can add Pen as your second item and that will make you better against the tank, but what about the other 4 champions on the enemy team?  You might be badly gimping your damage against them to do it building LW so early.  

Being able to kill their ADC or mid might be a lot more important than how much damage you can do to a tank.

Very well:
6 item builds 51 minute game, our Caitlyn vs their Ezreal. Ezreal was actually behind Caitlyn for the first half the game. Got LW as his 3rd item and finished his BOTRK before Dominiks knowing full well that he needed to break through our frontline as he would be the primary target for our team

End game Caitlyn with her 100% crit build was cursing profanities at "Broken" 300 armor 3khp Ekko and 200 armor 3khp Leona while Ezreal with his anti-tank items swiftly took down our 350 armor 3.5khp Malphite and 200 armor 3.5khp Nocturne.
Caitlyn had very strong peel and didnt even take half of Ekko's HP in 6 seconds while she was literally standing still autoattacking. Ezreal killed Malphite in 4 while kiting after dodging the ult and the E while using BOTRK movement speed and IBG slow to counter the Q

Ezreal also straight 1v1'd Caitlyn when she tried to kill him while he was killing Scuttle, that 100% crit mightve been scary on paper but Ezreal straight killed her with far less crit

We won only because we decided to not peel for Caitlyn and just dive Ezreal with everything we had. It worked, of course Caitlyn screamed profanities at "no peel" and "you need me!" as Ekko Leona and Nidalee shredded her but we won the slugfest afterwards.

EDIT: This isn't the game I was referring to originally in the OP, but another example of silliness of not buying lacking armor pen, this was a game that was way more frustrating than it needed to be, my game I am referring to in the OP was described below
{{champion:104}} Tanks? You mean punching bags?

"I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO CHANGE MY BUILD, WTF IS THIS BULLSHIT? GARBAGE BRONZE%%% TEAM OMG"
-ADC Probably
Played URF as Nasus on the PBE. When they /eq I immediately realized why they were so tanky. Building {{item:3027}} and nothing else. A {{item:3153}} solved that problem. (Nasus is an ADC right)

and in arams im the adc going yeah they are tanky but warwick why you ripping on me for getting the ability to survive but just feeding yourself to them (dead= no damage){{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

I agrea that marksmen are in an really powerfull state. It does count the same for dps tanks tho. It's probally more that the other role are just in an terrible state. #supports#mages#assasins are in the worsed spot. Hopefully mages get the fix next patches but after that whe still have 2 to go.
